note.p: Birth: Camberwell Grove, London, England (08 July 1836)

Career: Worked in a screw manufactory, Birmingham; retired (aged 38); MP for Birmingham (1876); President, Local Government Board (1886); Secretary for the Colonies (1895); retired from public life due to ill health (1906)
References: Vanity Fair 27 January 1877, 01 December 1898 (group), 30 November 1893 (group), 07 March 1901, 29 January 1908
Notes: Certificate of a Candidate of the privileged class for Election
